questions.text: If the president and vice-president die in a plane crash, who is next in line to be president in the United States?
options: someone elected by the deceased president's party
questions.explanation:
Speaker of the House.

	This has never happened before, and it is not likely this will happen because the president and vice-president do not travel together.

questions.text: In Girl Scouts of the USA, after you are done being a Brownie, what is the next level?
questions.explanation:
Junior.

	The correct order is Daisy, Brownie, Junior, Cadette, and last, but not least, Senior.

questions.text: On which holiday do people buy the most candy in the US?
Who plays Senator Amidala in "Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones"?
questions.explanation:
Natalie Portman.

	Senator Amidala used to be Queen Amidala in the first movie but is now Senator. She still needs decoys though.

questions.text: In what American Civil War-based book is one of the main characters named Scarlett O'Hara?
options: When Will This Cruel War Be Over?
questions.explanation:
Gone With the Wind.

	"Gone With the Wind" is also a VERY long movie.

questions.text: What is the capital of Texas?
questions.explanation:
Austin.

	Many people might think the capital is Dallas because of the Dallas Cowboys, but Austin is really the capital.

questions.text: The boundary separating North and South Korea is called the 38th parallel.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It was located on 38 degrees latitude north prior to the Korean War. Now the border is not a straight line but still roughly follows that same line. It is now officially the Line of Demarcation, or the Korean Demilitarized Zone.

questions.text: Who played Buffy in the series "Buffy the Vampire Slayer"?
questions.explanation:
Sarah Michelle Gellar.

	Gellar also plays Daphne in both "Scooby Doo" movies. The series ended when Gellar quit.

questions.text: In the Middle East what is a kibbutz?
questions.explanation:
A  collective community.

	A kibbutz is a small collective community.

questions.text: What is the date of the attack on Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation:
December 7, 1941.

	This was the first attack made on America during World War 2 and the reason America joined the Allied forces was to fight against the Axis powers. Like World War 1, America wanted to stay out of the war, but after being attacked decided to join.

questions.text: What castle is in the Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida?
questions.explanation:
Cinderella Castle.

	The Sleeping Beauty Castle is in Disneyland, in Anaheim, California.

questions.text: How many turtles are in mock-turtle soup?
questions.explanation:
0.

	Mock means fake so it would really be fake turtle soup.  It's made from veal.

questions.text: Who won the MLB World Series in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Yankees.

	The Yankees won the Subway Series against the Mets. It was a joyous moment for all Yankee fans.

questions.text: What is Dr. Seuss' REAL name?
questions.explanation:
Theodore Geisel.

	Ted Le Seig is another one of his pen names. Notice that Le Seig is a scramble on Geisel.

questions.text: One of the zip codes of Beverly Hills, California is 90210.
questions.explanation:
True.

	There are five zip codes for Beverly Hills 90209, 90210, 90211, 90212, and 90213.
